How To.question: How do you close a car door?
answers: Make sure fingers and feet are inside

How To.question: How do you turn on a light?
answers: Find the light switch on the wall

How To.question: How do you open a window?
answers: Grab the bottom of the window
Push or slide the window up

How To.question: How do you open a door?
answers: Grab the door handle or knob
Turn the knob or push down the handle
Pull or push the door open

How To.question: How do you turn on the water?
answers: Turn the handle to the left
Wait for water to come out

How To.question: How do you make your bed?
How do you turn off an alarm clock?
answers: Press the button to stop the alarm

How To.question: How do you turn on the TV?
How do you turn off a lamp?
answers: Find the lamp switch or knob
Turn the knob or flip the switch

How To.question: How do you answer the phone?
answers: Press the answer button or swipe

How To.question: How do you brush your teeth?
answers: Brush all your teeth in circles

How To.question: How do you wash your hands?
How do you brush your hair?
answers: Start at the ends of your hair
Work your way up to the roots

How To.question: How do you dry off after a bath?
answers: Get out of the tub carefully
Rub the towel all over your body
Don't forget your hair and feet

How To.question: How do you wash your hair?
How do you blow your nose?
answers: Blow air out through your nose

How To.question: How do you put on sunscreen?
answers: Rub it on your arms and legs
Put some on your face and ears

How To.question: How do you zip up a jacket?
answers: Line up the two sides of the zipper
Insert the pin into the slider
Hold the bottom and pull the zipper up

How To.question: How do you tie your shoes?
answers: Pull one lace under the other
Cross the loops and pull through

How To.question: How do you button a shirt?
answers: Line up the buttons with the holes
Push each button through its hole
Start from the top or bottom

How To.question: How do you put on velcro shoes?
answers: Put your foot in the shoe

How To.question: How do you put on a backpack?
answers: Put one arm through a strap
Put the other arm through the other strap

How To.question: How do you put on a hat?
answers: Hold the hat with both hands
Place it on top of your head

How To.question: How do you peel an orange?
answers: Dig your thumb into the skin
Pull off pieces of the peel

How To.question: How do you make a peanut butter sandwich?
answers: Spread peanut butter on the bread

How To.question: How do you pour a glass of water?
answers: Pick up the pitcher or bottle
Pour until the glass is full

How To.question: How do you peel a banana?
How do you pack a lunch?
answers: Put in a sandwich or main food

How To.question: How do you set up a beach towel?
answers: Find a flat spot on the sand
Lay it flat on the ground
Put something heavy on the corners

How To.question: How do you build a sandcastle?
answers: Get wet sand near the water

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Making French Fries
Short Stories Sequencing.story: My favorite food is French fries. Yesterday, I learned how to make French fries from scratch with my grandpa. First, we washed the potatoes. Then, we peeled the potatoes. After the potatoes were peeled, my grandpa helped me cut them into long strips. Once we were done, my grandpa carefully cooked them. Once they were finished, he put them on a tray to drain and cool. Once they had cooled a bit, I put them onto a platter with ketchup.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Fancy Family Dinner
Short Stories Sequencing.story: Last night, I decided to help my father cook a fancy dinner for the whole family. First, I helped my dad make some homemade dinner rolls. They smelled delicious! Afterwards, I helped my dad make a big, fresh salad. Once that was all set, we roasted some potatoes in the oven. Finally, once everything was prepared, my whole family sat on the deck and enjoyed the meal.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Beach Day
Short Stories Sequencing.story: My family went to the beach last Saturday. First, Mom helped us put on sunscreen so we wouldn't get burned. Then, we spread out our towels on the sand to save our spot. After that, my brother and I built a huge sandcastle with towers and a moat. We stayed until the sun started to set over the ocean. It was a perfect day.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Grocery Shopping
Short Stories Sequencing.story: Mom asked me to help with grocery shopping. First, we made a list of everything we needed. Then, we went to the store and put items in the cart. I helped find the fruits and vegetables. After we paid at self-checkout, we loaded the bags into the car. When we got home, we put all the groceries away on the counter and in the refrigerator.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Cleaning My Room
Short Stories Sequencing.story: My room was so messy I couldn't find anything. Mom said I had to clean it before I could go to the beach. First, I picked up all my toys and put them in the toy bin. Next, I organized my books on the shelf. Then I made my bed and put my dirty clothes in the hamper. Finally, my room was clean and I was ready to go!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Making a PB&J Sandwich
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I was hungry and wanted to make my own lunch. I decided to make a PB&J sandwich. First, I got two slices of bread from the bag. Then, I spread peanut butter on one slice. After that, I spread jelly on the other slice. Finally, I put the two slices together and cut the sandwich in half. It was delicious!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Morning Routine
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I have a morning routine that I follow every day. First, I wake up when my alarm goes off. Then, I go to the bathroom and brush my teeth. After that, I get dressed in my clothes for the day. Finally, I go to the kitchen and eat breakfast. Following my routine helps me get ready on time.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Walking the Dog
Short Stories Sequencing.story: My job is to walk our dog, Coco, every afternoon. First, I get her leash and attach it to her collar. Then, we walk around the neighborhood for about twenty minutes. When we get home, I give Coco fresh water to drink because she's thirsty. After drinking, Coco goes to her bed and takes a nap. She's tired from all the walking!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Making Muffins
Short Stories Sequencing.story: Grandma and I made muffins together. First, she got out all the ingredients like flour, sugar, and eggs. Then, we mixed everything together in a big bowl until the batter was smooth. Grandma put the batter into the muffin tin and placed it in the oven. After twenty minutes, she took out the muffins and put them on a cooling rack. They smelled amazing!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Cleaning the Fish Tank
Short Stories Sequencing.story: My fish tank was getting cloudy, so Dad helped me clean it. First, we looked at the tank and saw it really needed cleaning. Then, Dad carefully scooped out my fish with a net. He put them in a temporary bowl with some of their old water. After we cleaned the tank and added fresh water, we gently put the fish back in. They looked so happy in their clean home!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Building a Sandcastle
Short Stories Sequencing.story: My sister and I decided to build the best sandcastle ever. First, we gathered our bucket, shovel, and other tools. Then, we started digging and piling up wet sand to make the base. Next, we shaped towers and walls using our bucket. Finally, we decorated our castle with shells we found on the beach. Everyone who walked by said it looked amazing!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Making Homemade Pizza
Short Stories Sequencing.story: Dad let me help make homemade pizza for dinner. First, we rolled out the pizza dough on the counter. Then, I spread tomato sauce all over the dough with a spoon. Next, I added cheese and my favorite toppings like bell peppers and olives. Dad put it in the oven, and when it came out, it was bubbly and golden. It was the best pizza ever!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Tying My Shoes
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I finally learned how to tie my own shoes! First, I looked at my tangled shoelaces and knew I needed to start over. Then, I made two loops that looked like bunny ears. Next, I crossed one loop over the other. Finally, I pulled them tight and had a perfect bow! Now I can tie my shoes all by myself.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Brushing My Teeth
Short Stories Sequencing.story: Before bed, I always brush my teeth. First, I put toothpaste on my toothbrush. Then, I brush all my teeththe front, the back, and the chewing partsfor two whole minutes. After that, I rinse my mouth with water and spit it out. Finally, I smile in the mirror to check that my teeth are clean and shiny!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Planting Sunflowers
Short Stories Sequencing.story: We planted sunflowers in our backyard. First, Grandma showed me the seed packet and we read the directions. Then, I dug small holes in the soil for each seed. After I put the seeds in and covered them with dirt, I watered them gently. A few weeks later, I was so excited to see little green sprouts poking out of the ground!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Painting for Mom
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I made a painting for my mom's birthday. First, I gathered all my suppliespaint, brushes, and a canvas. Then, I carefully painted a picture of the beach because that's her favorite place. After I finished, I had to let the painting dry overnight. The next day, Dad helped me hang it on the wall. Mom loved her surprise!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Doing Laundry
Short Stories Sequencing.story: Mom taught me how to do laundry. First, I gathered all the dirty clothes and put them in the laundry basket. Then, I loaded them into the washing machine and added detergent. After the wash cycle was done, I moved the clothes to the dryer. When they were dry, I folded them neatly and put them away.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Packing for Vacation
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I packed my own suitcase for our beach vacation. First, I got my suitcase out of the closet. Then, I laid out all the clothes I wanted to bring on my bed. Next, I carefully folded each item and placed it in the suitcase. Finally, I zipped up my packed suitcase. I was ready for our trip!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Picking Oranges
Short Stories Sequencing.story: We visited an orange grove and picked our own oranges. First, we saw the beautiful orange trees full of fruit. Then, we reached up and picked the ripest oranges we could find. We filled a whole basket with oranges. When we got home, Dad helped us squeeze the oranges to make fresh juice. It was so sweet and delicious!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Doing a Puzzle
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I got a new puzzle and couldn't wait to put it together. First, I looked at the picture on the box to see what it would look like. Then, I dumped out all the pieces and spread them on the table. I started by finding all the edge pieces and worked my way in. After two hours, I finally placed the last piece. I did it!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Washing the Car
Short Stories Sequencing.story: Our car was so dirty you could write your name on it! Dad said we could wash it together. First, we got out the bucket, soap, and sponges. Then, we scrubbed the car with soapy water. After that, we rinsed off all the soap with the hose. Finally, the car was shiny and clean. It looked brand new!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Making Lemonade
Short Stories Sequencing.story: It was a hot day, so I decided to make lemonade. First, I got out the pitcher and filled it with water. Then, I squeezed lots of lemons into the water. After that, I added sugar and stirred until it dissolved. Finally, I poured a cold glass of lemonade and took a big sip. So refreshing!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Shower Routine
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I had a sleepy start to my morning. First, I woke up feeling very tired and rubbed my eyes. Then, I took a warm shower to help me wake up. After my shower, I got dressed in my favorite outfit. Finally, I looked in the mirror and felt ready to start my day!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Inflating the Floatie
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I wanted to use my floatie in the pool. First, I got out my flat, deflated floatie. Then, Dad used the pump to blow air into it. Once it was full of air, I put it in the water. Finally, I climbed on and floated happily in the pool. It was so relaxing!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Making a Salad
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I helped Mom make a big salad for dinner. First, I washed all the lettuce and put it in a spinner to dry. Then, Mom helped chop the cucumbers, tomatoes, and bell peppers. After we put all the vegetables in a bowl, I added the salad dressing. Finally, we served the salad to everyone at the table.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Waking Up
Short Stories Sequencing.story: Every morning starts the same way for me. First, my alarm clock rings loudly on my nightstand. Then, I stretch my arms up high while still in bed. Next, I put my feet on the floor and stand up slowly. Finally, I walk to the bathroom to start getting ready for the day.

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Filling the Bird Feeder
Short Stories Sequencing.story: The birds in our yard were hungry because the feeder was empty. First, I noticed there was no more seed in the bird feeder. Then, I got the bag of birdseed from the garage. I carefully poured the seed into the feeder until it was full. Soon, lots of birds came to eat. They were so happy!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Making Cereal
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I made my own breakfast this morning. First, I got a bowl and spoon from the cabinet. Then, I poured my favorite cereal into the bowl. Next, I carefully poured milk over the cereal. Finally, I sat down at the table and ate my crunchy breakfast. I did it all by myself!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Drawing for Grandma
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I made a picture for Grandma. First, I got a blank piece of paper from my desk. Then, I drew a picture of the beach with pencil. Next, I colored in the ocean, sand, and sky with my crayons. Finally, my artwork was finished and ready to give to Grandma. She put it on her refrigerator!

Short Stories Sequencing.question: Put these steps in order: Washing My Hands
Short Stories Sequencing.story: I always wash my hands before eating. First, I wet my hands and add soap. Then, I scrub my hands together for twenty seconds, making sure to get between my fingers. After that, I rinse off all the soap under the water. Finally, I dry my hands with a clean towel. Now they're clean!
